title: How to Make Strawberry and Orange Gelatin Gummy Bears

steps.headline: Add the citrus juices and strawberries to a small pot.
steps.description: Place the pot over medium heat and allow the mixture to simmer.

steps.headline: Remove from the heat when the strawberries are soft.
Blend the mixture with the Stevia until smooth.
Allow the mixture to cool for a few minutes.
Blend the mixture again, along with five packets of unflavored gelatin.
Pour the mixture into a pan.
steps.description: The deepness of the pan will determine the thickness of the gummy bears.

steps.headline: Chill the mixture.
steps.description: Set the pan in the refrigerator for about an hour, or until firm.

steps.headline: Use a mini gummy bear cutter on the mixture.
steps.description: Start at the top corner to make the most bears and least scraps.

text: Add the citrus juices and strawberries to a small pot. Place the pot over medium heat and allow the mixture to simmer. Remove from the heat when the strawberries are soft.  Blend the mixture with the Stevia until smooth.  Allow the mixture to cool for a few minutes.  Blend the mixture again, along with five packets of unflavored gelatin.  Pour the mixture into a pan. The deepness of the pan will determine the thickness of the gummy bears. Chill the mixture. Set the pan in the refrigerator for about an hour, or until firm. Use a mini gummy bear cutter on the mixture. Start at the top corner to make the most bears and least scraps. Finished.
